issue.title: OpenSSL reference tests are linked against the wrong library
issue.body:
The oqs-ref shared library is copied to liboqs.so.LIBOQS_VERSION instead of liboqs.so.$LIBOQS_VERSION:
https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/profiling/blob/9ff4911c5169196eae3e6f3947e79003b0ed02d4/perf/scripts/run-tests.sh#L33

comment.body: Bummer. Thanks for pointing that out! Invalidates all openssl-ref runs :-(

issue.title: Decide on further profiling runs
issue.body:
Now that additional AWS credits are available, decide which additional things to profile.

Options: Different CPU types (AMD, ARM (which), ...?) New OSs (OSX, Windows, RedHat, ... -- some possibly on ARM64) further network simulations, ...???

Input solicited: Additional options? Priorities?

Edit: Instance types: https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/instance-types/

comment.body: Result: Steep performance drop on debian. Some trialing now why this may be so: gcc8 in debian much worse than gcc9 in alpine? Or should we rather use clang (which version) on debian? Any experiences what should be best? Or should we benchmark different compiler/version combinations (yet another alternative switch -- shudder)?

issue.title: Decide on further profiling runs
issue.body:
Now that additional AWS credits are available, decide which additional things to profile.

Options: Different CPU types (AMD, ARM (which), ...?) New OSs (OSX, Windows, RedHat, ... -- some possibly on ARM64) further network simulations, ...???

Input solicited: Additional options? Priorities?

Edit: Instance types: https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/instance-types/

comment.body:
Answering my own question: clang (7) is definitely much better than gcc (8) on debian in the same VM: Example

```
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  x86_64-Linux-4.14.193-149.317.amzn2.x86_64
Compiler:         gcc (8.3.0)
Compile options:  [-march=x86-64;-Werror;-Wall;-Wextra;-Wpedantic;-Wstrict-prototypes;-Wshadow;-Wformat=2;-Wfloat-equal;-Wwrite-strings;-O3;-fomit-frame-pointer;-fdata-sections;-ffunction-sections;-Wl,--gc-sections;-Wbad-function-cast]
OQS version:      0.6.0-dev
Git commit:       a04ef8d3ca14baa4d192874e1e4746b7edaf9fc5
OpenSSL enabled:  Yes (OpenSSL 1.1.1d  10 Sep 2019)
AES:              OpenSSL
SHA-2:            OpenSSL
SHA-3:            C
CPU exts active:  ADX AES AVX AVX2 AVX512 BMI1 BMI2 PCLMULQDQ POPCNT SSE SSE2 SSE3
Speed test
==========
Started at 2021-04-21 08:13:11
Operation                      | Iterations | Total time (s) | Time (us): mean | pop. stdev | CPU cycles: mean          | pop. stdev
------------------------------ | ----------:| --------------:| ---------------:| ----------:| -------------------------:| ----------:
FrodoKEM-640-SHAKE             |            |                |                 |            |                           |           
keygen                         |       2786 |          3.000 |        1076.934 |     54.077 |                   2692112 |     135204
encaps                         |       2454 |          3.000 |        1222.581 |     62.326 |                   3056234 |     155798
decaps                         |       2382 |          3.000 |        1259.637 |    219.353 |                   3148905 |     548323
Ended at 2021-04-21 08:13:20
```
vs
```
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  x86_64-Linux-4.14.193-149.317.amzn2.x86_64
Compiler:         clang (7.0.1 (tags/RELEASE_701/final))
Compile options:  [-march=native;-Werror;-Wall;-Wextra;-Wpedantic;-Wno-unused-command-line-argument;-O3;-fomit-frame-pointer;-Wbad-function-cast;-Wcast-qual;-Wnarrowing;-Wconversion]
OQS version:      0.6.0-dev
Git commit:       a04ef8d3ca14baa4d192874e1e4746b7edaf9fc5

AES:              OpenSSL
SHA-2:            OpenSSL
SHA-3:            C
CPU exts active:  ADX AES AVX AVX2 AVX512 BMI1 BMI2 POPCNT SSE SSE2 SSE3

Speed test
==========

Operation                      | Iterations | Total time (s) | Time (us): mean | pop. stdev | CPU cycles: mean          | pop. stdev
------------------------------ | ----------:| --------------:| ---------------:| ----------:| -------------------------:| ----------:
FrodoKEM-640-SHAKE             |            |                |                 |            |                           |           
keygen                         |       3644 |          3.001 |         823.431 |     63.071 |                   2058326 |     157690
encaps                         |       3203 |          3.001 |         936.829 |     47.400 |                   2341866 |     118478
decaps                         |       3214 |          3.001 |         933.619 |     47.421 |                   2333920 |     118570
Ended at 2021-04-21 08:14:05
```
AND debian/clang7 is better than alpine/gcc9 in the same VM:
```
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  x86_64-Linux-4.10.0-35-generic

Speed test

Started at 2021-04-21 08:18:10
Operation                      | Iterations | Total time (s) | Time (us): mean | pop. stdev | CPU cycles: mean          | pop. stdev
------------------------------ | ----------:| --------------:| ---------------:| ----------:| -------------------------:| ----------:
FrodoKEM-640-SHAKE             |            |                |                 |            |                           |

--> Will switch to debian/clang7 unless I hear protests.

issue.title: Decide on further profiling runs
issue.body:
Now that additional AWS credits are available, decide which additional things to profile.

Options: Different CPU types (AMD, ARM (which), ...?) New OSs (OSX, Windows, RedHat, ... -- some possibly on ARM64) further network simulations, ...???

Input solicited: Additional options? Priorities?

Edit: Instance types: https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/instance-types/

comment.body:
Now doing all tests _in the same VM and in the same docker image_ seems to indicate gcc8 is the better choice after all (iff/when getting the build options right). The below were built using `cmake -GNinja [-DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=clang] -DOQS_MINIMAL_BUILD=ON -DOQS_KEM_DEFAULT="OQS_KEM_alg_frodokem_640_shake" ..`

```
root@3f85e33700a8:/opt/liboqs# ./build-gcc-nooptions/tests/speed_kem FrodoKEM-640-SHAKE
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  x86_64-Linux-4.14.193-149.317.amzn2.x86_64
Compiler:         gcc (8.3.0)
Compile options:  [-march=native;-Werror;-Wall;-Wextra;-Wpedantic;-Wstrict-prototypes;-Wshadow;-Wformat=2;-Wfloat-equal;-Wwrite-strings;-O3;-fomit-frame-pointer;-fdata-sections;-ffunction-sections;-Wl,--gc-sections;-Wbad-function-cast]
OQS version:      0.6.0-dev
Git commit:       a89e3ac581574d55494dea41fd1cc7b272603ee3
OpenSSL enabled:  Yes (OpenSSL 1.1.1d  10 Sep 2019)
AES:              OpenSSL
SHA-2:            OpenSSL
SHA-3:            C
CPU exts active:  ADX AES AVX AVX2 AVX512 BMI1 BMI2 POPCNT SSE SSE2 SSE3

Speed test
==========
Started at 2021-04-21 10:27:46

------------------------------ | ----------:| --------------:| ---------------:| ----------:| -------------------------:| ----------:
FrodoKEM-640-SHAKE             |            |                |                 |            |                           |           
keygen                         |       3534 |          3.000 |         849.015 |     38.758 |                   2122271 |      96884
encaps                         |       3074 |          3.001 |         976.207 |     41.688 |                   2440300 |     104253
decaps                         |       3132 |          3.001 |         958.065 |     41.184 |                   2395010 |     102961
Ended at 2021-04-21 10:27:55
root@3f85e33700a8:/opt/liboqs# ./build-clang-nooptions/tests/speed_kem FrodoKEM-640-SHAKE
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  x86_64-Linux-4.14.193-149.317.amzn2.x86_64
Compiler:         clang (7.0.1 (tags/RELEASE_701/final))
Compile options:  [-march=native;-Werror;-Wall;-Wextra;-Wpedantic;-Wno-unused-command-line-argument;-O3;-fomit-frame-pointer;-Wbad-function-cast;-Wcast-qual;-Wnarrowing;-Wconversion]
OQS version:      0.6.0-dev

AES:              OpenSSL
SHA-2:            OpenSSL
SHA-3:            C
CPU exts active:  ADX AES AVX AVX2 AVX512 BMI1 BMI2 POPCNT SSE SSE2 SSE3

Speed test
==========
Started at 2021-04-21 10:28:37
Operation                      | Iterations | Total time (s) | Time (us): mean | pop. stdev | CPU cycles: mean          | pop. stdev
------------------------------ | ----------:| --------------:| ---------------:| ----------:| -------------------------:| ----------:
FrodoKEM-640-SHAKE             |            |                |                 |            |                           |           
keygen                         |       3347 |          3.000 |         896.426 |     43.066 |                   2240769 |     107654
encaps                         |       3103 |          3.001 |         967.110 |     41.317 |                   2417564 |     103300
decaps                         |       3128 |          3.001 |         959.355 |     41.522 |                   2398240 |     103811
Ended at 2021-04-21 10:28:46
root@3f85e33700a8:/opt/liboqs# 
```

Skylake figures are consistently lower (`cmake -GNinja  [-DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=clang]  -DOQS_MINIMAL_BUILD=ON -DOQS_KEM_DEFAULT="OQS_KEM_alg_frodokem_640_shake" -DOQS_OPT_TARGET="skylake" ..`):

```

OQS version:      0.6.0-dev

-> Back to square one: Why did the debian test runs seem slower than alpine? I'll redo everything...

issue.title: Decide on further profiling runs
issue.body:
Now that additional AWS credits are available, decide which additional things to profile.

Options: Different CPU types (AMD, ARM (which), ...?) New OSs (OSX, Windows, RedHat, ... -- some possibly on ARM64) further network simulations, ...???

Input solicited: Additional options? Priorities?

Edit: Instance types: https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/instance-types/

comment.body:
I'm not sure why CMake passed -march=x86-64 in some of your runs. The only way that could happen with OQS_OPT_TARGET=auto is if OQS_DIST_BUILD=ON or CMAKE_CROSSCOMPILING=ON.

> Ahh -- should we better use "skylake-avx512" than plain skylake (to get a fast, non-distributable, but well-defined --instead of `-mnative`-- build)? @jschanck any opinion?

Yes that's a good option for the machine that you're running tests on.

issue.title: Decide on further profiling runs
issue.body:
Now that additional AWS credits are available, decide which additional things to profile.

Options: Different CPU types (AMD, ARM (which), ...?) New OSs (OSX, Windows, RedHat, ... -- some possibly on ARM64) further network simulations, ...???

Input solicited: Additional options? Priorities?

Edit: Instance types: https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/instance-types/

comment.body:
> The only way that could happen with OQS_OPT_TARGET=auto is if OQS_DIST_BUILD=ON

The "plain" (i.e., not Reference nor Performance) config does have `OQS_DIST_BUILD` ON.
Oops - the initial commit message caused CI to not run at all when merging - thus the new Docker image didn't get pushed. Will follow up with an update triggering that push...

issue.title: Take stock of all algorithms
issue.body:
This issue to capture what we discussed today (also for the benefit of @christianpaquin): 

- Create a current view as to where we stand for each algorithm (round3 readiness, code level, etc.)
- Decide whether/how to parcel out work to arrive at 0.5 release readiness (incl. whether/how to address common code issues as per #849).
- Probably also list release-criteria for 0.5 (not discussed today but in a previous meeting).

@dstebila @xvzcf are working on this.

comment.body:
Here's the slightly reworked YAML:

```yaml
name: FrodoKEM
type: kem
principal-submitters:
  - Michael Naehrig
  - Erdem Alkim
  - Joppe Bos
  - Lo Ducas
  - Karen Easterbrook
  - Brian LaMacchia
  - Patrick Longa
  - Ilya Mironov
  - Valeria Nikolaenko
  - Christopher Peikert
  - Ananth Raghunathan
  - Douglas Stebila
auxiliary-submitters: []
crypto-assumption: learning with errors (LWE)
website: https://frodokem.org/
nist-round: 3
spec-version: NIST Round 3 submission
spdx-license-identifier: MIT
implementation-chain:
  - SAMPLE_URL_LEAF
  - SAMPLE_URL_INT
  - https://github.com/microsoft/PQCrypto-LWEKE/commit/669522db63850fa64d1a24a47e138e80a59349db
parameter-sets:
  -
    name: FrodoKEM-640-AES
    claimed-nist-level: 1
    claimed-security: IND-CCA2
    length-public-key: 9616
    length-ciphertext: 9720
    length-secret-key: 19888
    length-shared-secret: 16
    implementations:
      -
        arch: x86-64
        portable: yes
        platforms: [Linux, macOS, Windows]
        cpu-extensions-used: [AVX2, AESNI]
        common-crypto:
          - AES: liboqs
          - SHA2: liboqs
        no-secret-dependent-branching-claimed: true
        no-secret-dependent-branching-checked-by-valgrind: true
        large-stack-usage: false
      -
        arch: armel
        portable: no
        cpu-extensions-used: []
        platforms: [Linux, macOS, Windows]
        common-crypto:
          - AES: liboqs
          - SHA2: liboqs
        no-secret-dependent-branching-claimed: true
        no-secret-dependent-branching-checked-by-valgrind: true
        large-stack-usage: false
      -
        arch: armhf
        portable: yes
        platforms: [Linux]
        cpu-extensions-used: []
        common-crypto:
          - AES: liboqs
          - SHA2: liboqs
        no-secret-dependent-branching-claimed: true
        no-secret-dependent-branching-checked-by-valgrind: true
        large-stack-usage: false
```

------------------------------

and the associated documentation markdown:

# FrodoKEM

- **Algorithm type**: key encapsulation mechanism
- **Main cryptographic assumption**: learning with errors (LWE).
- **Authors website**: https://frodokem.org/.
- **Specification version**: NIST Round 3 submission.
- **Implementation taken from**
  - SAMPLE_URL_LEAF, which takes it from
  - SAMPLE_URL_INT, which takes it from
  - https://github.com/microsoft/PQCrypto-LWEKE/commit/669522db63850fa64d1a24a47e138e80a59349db
- **License (SPDX-Identifier)**: MIT.

## Parameter set summary

|  Parameter set   | Security Model   |   Claimed NIST Level |   Public key size (bytes) |   Secret key size (bytes) |   Ciphertext size (bytes) |   Shared secret size (bytes) |
|:----------------:|:-----------------|---------------------:|--------------------------:|--------------------------:|--------------------------:|-----------------------------:|
| FrodoKEM-640-AES | IND-CCA2         |                    1 |                      9616 |                     19888 |                      9720 |                           16 |

## FrodoKEM-640-AES implementation characteristics

|  Architecture  | Platforms            | CPU Extensions Used   | Portable?   | No branching-on-secrets claimed?   | No branching-on-secrets checked by valgrind?   | Large stack usage?   |
|:--------------:|:---------------------|:----------------------|:------------|:-----------------------------------|:-----------------------------------------------|:---------------------|
|     x86-64     | Linux,macOS,Windows, | AVX2,AESNI,           | True        | True                               | True                                           | False                |
|     armel      | Linux,macOS,Windows, |                       | False       | True                               | True                                           | False                |
|     armhf      | Linux,               |                       | True        | True                               | True                                           | False                |

## Explanation of terms

- Large stack usage: INSERT_EXPLANATION_HERE

issue.title: Take stock of all algorithms
issue.body:
This issue to capture what we discussed today (also for the benefit of @christianpaquin): 

- Create a current view as to where we stand for each algorithm (round3 readiness, code level, etc.)
- Decide whether/how to parcel out work to arrive at 0.5 release readiness (incl. whether/how to address common code issues as per #849).
- Probably also list release-criteria for 0.5 (not discussed today but in a previous meeting).

@dstebila @xvzcf are working on this.

issue.title: keyscan test failing
issue.body:
The keyscan test (invoked when running `make tests`) fails for the OQS algs.

@dstebila, @xvzcf, can you repro this?
